Identity, Copywriting, Ad Campaign, Merchandise Design

Solo Project

Seattle Documentary
Film Festival

The Seattle Documentary Film Festival's proposed theme for 2016 builds on Seattle's rich music culture to focus exclusively on music documentaries. With such a specific theme for the festival, a fresh, clear-cut marketing campaign was needed. The tagline playfully compares the unrivaled lineup of SDFF with that of Seattle's iconic Bumbershoot music and arts festival. The full SDFF 2016 campaign builds from this tagline and reflects a dynamic, artistic, and musical feel with a new logo, merchandise, and marketing assets.

Previous Back to Projects Next

Michel DeBauge is a Seattle-based graphic designer with an interest in interactive digital media, user experience, and visual identity design.

A grad of SCCA, he has been a musician in the band, Western Haunts, and before that, graduated from UW with degrees in Psychology and Communication. Recently, he's worked at SAP - Concur as a design intern and also volunteers at ChickTech, teaching web design to high school students.

For full-time or freelance inquiries: micheldebauge@gmail.com
